title: Creating a Farm Friendly to Biodiversity and Produce Safety Video

subtasks: Understand the importance of microbial, plant, and animal life in a sustainable farming system
Consider conservation of natural resources, farm economic sustainability, and produce safety
Implement elements such as hedgerows and riparian zones
Provide pollinators with diverse flowering plants throughout the season
Create habitats for wildlife, reducing their presence in crop fields
Use nesting boxes to support bird populations
Minimize bird droppings on produce through strategic placement of birdhouses
Utilize bat boxes to reduce insect and nematode pest populations
Employ insectries to attract beneficial insects and pollinators
Balance the benefits of wildlife presence with potential risks to produce safety
Seek financial assistance from programs like the Environmental Quality Incentives Program
Obtain technical expertise from USDA Natural Resource Conservation Service and Extension for implementation

tasks.task: Introduce biodiversity for conservation and produce safety
subtasks: Assess the need for introducing various forms of biodiversity on the farm
Utilize resources from USDA Natural Resource Conservation Service and Extension
Implement environmental conservation strategies while considering economic benefits
Evaluate the role of different habitats (hedgerows, nesting boxes, bat boxes) in supporting biodiversity
Monitor wildlife activity and adjust strategies to minimize negative impacts on crops
Coordinate with local agricultural extension services for best practices
